title.narrative: To provide support to vulnerable community through multi purpose cash transfer in UP, Bihar and Delh

description.narrative: EFICOR is working in Delhi, UP and Bihar with the most marginalised community who are depending on daily wages for their livelihood. In this intervention the targeted community would be migrants, PWDs, single women headed HH and people with HIV and HH who lost their earning member due to Covid. Migrants from other cities are returning to villlages and their livelihood and food security is at stake. EFICOR to provide multi purpose cash transfer to the targeted community in 5 villages in Manikpur block of Chitrakoot district of Uttar Pradesh to cover 600 HH, 10 villages in Madhur block of Madhubani district of Bihar to cover 600 HH and in Delhi/NCR Krishna Colony in West Delhi to cover 550 HH. In Total EFICOR to provide direct cash benefit of INR 2000/- through bank transfer to 1750 HH ( 8750 individuals) in three States of India. All the beneficiaries to be mapped through KOBO Collect digital app and necessary documents to be collected and verified by the project staff before transferring the amount.

Multipurpose cash transfer to community provides flexibility and freedom to spend on any immediate needs. Using KOBO App to support in identified HH data are collected authentically and all documents to be uploaded into server quickly. Using Kobo collect also eliminates chances of dublicate entries and the records can be verified any time.

participating-org.narrative: THE EVANGELICAL FELLOWSHIP OF INDIA COMMISSION ON RELIEF (EFICOR)
